channel.description: Recent content in Jpa on On Code & Design

item.title: A Practical Solution for XML-to-Relational Mapping
item.description: A challenge in the field of integration is persisting to a relational database the contents of an XML document [1]. At first glance, this might seem like a no-brainer. Create a database table where each column maps to an element defined in the XML document's XSD. Then write an INSERT SQL statement that iterates through each element of the XML document. But what if an XML element has attributes? What about elements containing other elements?
